interactionClass.semantics: An interaction sent to an environment manager to request the creation, modification, or deletion of instances of the OtherPointObject class.

interactionClass.name: RibbonBridgeObjectTransaction
interactionClass.semantics: An interaction sent to an environment manager to request the creation, modification, or deletion of instances of the RibbonBridgeObject class.

parameter.name: NumberOfSegments
parameter.semantics: Specifies the number of segments composing the ribbon bridge

interactionClass.name: StructureObjectTransaction
interactionClass.semantics: An interaction sent to an environment manager to request the creation, modification, or deletion of instances of the StructureObject class.

interactionClass.name: MinefieldQuery
interactionClass.semantics: Provides the means by which a federate shall query a minefield simulation for information on the individual mines within the minefield operating in QRP mode.

parameter.name: MinefieldIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Identifies the minefield to which this query is addressed

parameter.name: PerimeterPoints
parameter.semantics: Specifies the location of each perimeter point in the requested area relative to the minefield location

parameter.name: QueryFusing
parameter.semantics: Specifies whether or not fusing is requested

parameter.name: QueryMineOrientation
parameter.semantics: Specifies whether or not orientation is requested

parameter.name: QueryGroundBurialDepthOffset
parameter.semantics: Specifies whether or not ground burial depth offset is requested

parameter.name: QueryMineEmplacementAge
parameter.semantics: Specifies whether or not emplacement age is requested

parameter.name: QueryPaintScheme
parameter.semantics: Specifies whether or not paint scheme is requested

parameter.name: QueryReflectance
parameter.semantics: Specifies whether or not reflectance is requested

parameter.name: QueryScalarDetectionCoefficient
parameter.semantics: Specifies whether or not scalar detection coefficient is requested

parameter.name: QuerySnowBurialDepthOffset
parameter.semantics: Specifies whether or not snow burial depth offset is requested

parameter.name: QueryThermalContrast
parameter.semantics: Specifies whether or not thermal contrast is requested

parameter.name: QueryTripDetonationWire
parameter.semantics: Specifies whether or not trip detonation wire is requested

parameter.name: QueryWaterBurialDepthOffset
parameter.semantics: Specifies whether or not water burial depth offset is requested

parameter.name: RequestingEntityIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Identifies the entity that requests the information from the minefield simulation

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Identifies the minefield query request

parameter.name: RequestedMineType
parameter.semantics: Identifies the type of mine being queried by the requesting federate

parameter.name: SensorTypes
parameter.semantics: Specifies the types of sensors requesting the data

interactionClass.name: MinefieldData
interactionClass.semantics: Provides information on individual mines contained within a minefield

parameter.name: GroundBurialDepthOffset
parameter.semantics: Specifies the offset of the origin of the mine coordinate system with respect to the ground surface

parameter.name: Fusing
parameter.semantics: Specifies the primary and secondary fuse and anti-handling device for each mine

parameter.name: MineEmplacementTime
parameter.semantics: Specifies the real-world (UTC) emplacement time of the mine

parameter.name: MineEntityIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Identifies the mine entity identifier; the MineEntityID in conjunction with the MinefieldID form the unique identifier for each mine

parameter.name: MinefieldIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Identifies the minefield to which the mines belong

parameter.name: MineLocation
parameter.semantics: Specifies the location of the relative to the minefield location

parameter.name: MineOrientation
parameter.semantics: Specifies the orientation of the center axis direction of fire of the mine, relative to the minefield Coordinate System

parameter.name: MineType
parameter.semantics: Specifies the type of each mine contained within the minefield interaction

parameter.name: NumberOfRecords
parameter.semantics: Specifies the total number of minefield records being published in response to a Minefield Query interaction

parameter.name: NumberTripDetonationWires
parameter.semantics: Specifies the number of trip detonation wires that exist for each mine

parameter.name: NumberWireVertices
parameter.semantics: Specifies the number of vertices for each trip wire

parameter.name: PaintScheme
parameter.semantics: Specifies the camouflage scheme/color of the mine

parameter.name: RecordSequenceNumber
parameter.semantics: Specifies the number of the current record in a sequence of minefield records published in response to a Minefield Query interaction

parameter.name: Reflectance
parameter.semantics: Specifies the local dielectric difference between the mine and the surrounding soil

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Identifies the matching response to a request for mine information from the minefield simulation made by means of a Minefield Query interaction

parameter.name: RequestingEntityIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Identifies the entity that requested the information from the minefield simulation in QRP (Query Response Protocol) mode

parameter.name: ScalarDetectionCoefficient
parameter.semantics: Specifies the coefficient to be utilized to insure proper correlation between detectors located on different simulation platforms

parameter.name: SensorTypes
parameter.semantics: In QRP mode, specifies the requesting sensor types which were specified in the minefield query whereas in Heartbeat mode, specifies the sensor types that are being served by the minefield

parameter.name: SnowBurialDepthOffset
parameter.semantics: Specifies the offset of the origin of the mine coordinate system with respect to the snow surface

parameter.name: ThermalContrast
parameter.semantics: Specifies the temperature difference between the mine and the surrounding soil in degrees Centigrade

parameter.name: WaterBurialDepthOffset
parameter.semantics: Specifies the offset of the origin of the mine coordinate system with respect to the water surface

parameter.name: WireVertices
parameter.semantics: Specifies the locations of vertices in a trip wire

interactionClass.name: MinefieldResponseNACK
interactionClass.semantics: A response to a MinefieldQuery providing information on individual mines within a minefield.

parameter.name: MinefieldIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Identifies the minefield to which this query is addressed

parameter.name: MissingRecordNumbers
parameter.semantics: Specifies the record numbers that were not received in a sequence of minefield records

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Identifies the minefield query request

parameter.name: RequestingEntityIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Identifies the entity that requested the information from the minefield simulation

interactionClass.name: AcousticTransient
interactionClass.semantics: Specifies the occurrence of a transient acoustic event such as torpedo tube floodings, hatch slams, and wrench drops.

parameter.name: ActivityCode
parameter.semantics: Index into a data base of transient acoustic events

parameter.name: ActivityParameter
parameter.semantics: The current state of the activity specified by the activity code

parameter.name: HostObjectIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Object Instance ID of the object emitting the sound

parameter.name: RelativePosition
parameter.semantics: The location of the sound relative to the hosts coordinate system

interactionClass.name: WeaponFire
interactionClass.semantics: Communicates information associated with the firing or launch of a munition.

parameter.name: EventIdentifier
parameter.semantics: An ID, generated by the issuing federate, used to associate related fire and detonation events.

parameter.name: FireControlSolutionRange
parameter.semantics: The range used in the fire control solution. Zero if the range is unknown or inapplicable.

parameter.name: FireMissionIndex
parameter.semantics: A unique index to identify the fire mission (used to associate weapon fire interactions in a single fire mission).

parameter.name: FiringLocation
parameter.semantics: The location, in world coordinates, from which the munition was launched.

parameter.name: FiringObjectIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The object instance ID of the entity firing the munition.

parameter.name: FuseType
parameter.semantics: The type of fuse on the munition.

parameter.name: InitialVelocityVector
parameter.semantics: The velocity vector of the munition when fired.

parameter.name: MunitionObjectIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The object instance ID of the fired munition, if an object instance is registered.

parameter.name: MunitionType
parameter.semantics: The type of munition being fired.

parameter.name: QuantityFired
parameter.semantics: The number of rounds fired in the burst.

parameter.name: RateOfFire
parameter.semantics: The rate of fire in rounds per minute when quantity > 1. Zero otherwise.

parameter.name: TargetObjectIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The object instance ID of the intended target (if any).

parameter.name: WarheadType
parameter.semantics: The type of warhead fitted to the munition being fired.

interactionClass.name: MunitionDetonation
interactionClass.semantics: Communicates information associated with the impact or detonation of a munition

parameter.name: ArticulatedPartData
parameter.semantics: The set of articulated parts affected by the detonation (including where on the articulated part the detonation has affected).

parameter.name: DetonationLocation
parameter.semantics: The location, in world coordinates, at which the munition detonated.

parameter.name: DetonationResultCode
parameter.semantics: The type of detonation (including no detonation).

parameter.name: EventIdentifier
parameter.semantics: An ID, generated by the issuing federate, used to associate related fire and detonation events.

parameter.name: FiringObjectIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The object instance ID of the entity that fired the munition.

parameter.name: FinalVelocityVector
parameter.semantics: The velocity vector of the munition at the moment of the detonation.

parameter.name: FuseType
parameter.semantics: The type of fuse on the munition.

parameter.name: MunitionObjectIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Object instance ID of the fired munition, if an object instance is registered.

parameter.name: MunitionType
parameter.semantics: The type of munition that is detonating.

parameter.name: QuantityFired
parameter.semantics: The number of rounds fired in the burst.

parameter.name: RateOfFire
parameter.semantics: The rate of fire in rounds per minute when quantity > 1. Zero otherwise.

parameter.name: RelativeDetonationLocation
parameter.semantics: The location of the detonation in coordinates relative to the target entity (if any).

parameter.name: TargetObjectIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The object instance ID of the entity that the munition has detonated on (if any).

parameter.name: WarheadType
parameter.semantics: The type of warhead on the munition.

interactionClass.name: RepairComplete
interactionClass.semantics: Notifies the requesting entity that the requested repair has been completed.

parameter.name: ReceivingObject
parameter.semantics: Object requesting repairs

parameter.name: RepairingObject
parameter.semantics: Object that is able to perform the requested repair

parameter.name: RepairType
parameter.semantics: Type of repair performed

interactionClass.name: RepairResponse
interactionClass.semantics: Acknowledges the notification of the completion of a repair.

parameter.name: ReceivingObject
parameter.semantics: Object requesting repairs

parameter.name: RepairingObject
parameter.semantics: Object that is able to perform the requested repair

parameter.name: RepairResultCode
parameter.semantics: Result of repair

interactionClass.name: ResupplyCancel
interactionClass.semantics: Communicates the canceling of a service function by either the receiving or the supplying entity.

parameter.name: ReceivingObject
parameter.semantics: Object that is receiving supplies

parameter.name: SupplyingObject
parameter.semantics: Object that has offered supplies

interactionClass.name: ResupplyOffer
interactionClass.semantics: Communicates the offer of supplies from a supplying entity to a receiving entity.

parameter.name: ReceivingObject
parameter.semantics: Object that the supplies are being offered to.

parameter.name: SupplyingObject
parameter.semantics: Object that is offering the supplies

parameter.name: SuppliesData
parameter.semantics: List of supplies that are offered.

interactionClass.name: ResupplyReceived
interactionClass.semantics: Acknowledge the receipt of supplies.

parameter.name: ReceivingObject
parameter.semantics: Object that is receiving the supplies

parameter.name: SupplyingObject
parameter.semantics: Object that is providing the supplies.

parameter.name: SuppliesData
parameter.semantics: List of supplies taken by receiving object.

interactionClass.name: ServiceRequest
interactionClass.semantics: A request for logistics support. The requesting entity issues the interaction to the supplying entity asking for repair or specific supplies.

parameter.name: RequestingObject
parameter.semantics: Object requesting service

parameter.name: ServicingObject
parameter.semantics: Object that is able to provide the requested service

parameter.name: ServiceType
parameter.semantics: Type of requested service

parameter.name: SuppliesData
parameter.semantics: For a service of resupply, the list of supplies to be exchanged. If the service requested is not resupply, then this parameter shall be omitted.

interactionClass.name: Acknowledge
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a SIMAN PDU from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the federate has implemented the request.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific StartResume, StopFreeze, CreateEntity or RemoveEntity interaction sent by the simulation manager.

parameter.name: AcknowledgeFlag
parameter.semantics: The type of interaction being acknowledged.

parameter.name: ResponseFlag
parameter.semantics: The type of response made to the interaction by the recipient.

interactionClass.name: AcknowledgeR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a SIMAN PDU, with a specified acknowledgement protocol, from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the federate has implemented the request.

interactionClass.name: ActionRequest
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction sent from a Simulation Manager federate to one or more federates to request that they perform a specified action.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: ActionRequestCode
parameter.semantics: The action that the recipient(s) are requested to perform.

parameter.name: FixedDatums
parameter.semantics: Optional additional data items (types and values)

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: Optional additional data items (types and values). These data items are not of fixed length.

interactionClass.name: ActionRequestR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction sent from a Simulation Manager federate to one or more federates to request that they perform a specified action. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: ActionResponse
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an ActionResponse interaction from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the federate has implemented the request.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific ActionRequest interaction sent by the simulation manager.

parameter.name: RequestStatus
parameter.semantics: The status of the request that the recipient has been asked to perform.

parameter.name: FixedDatums
parameter.semantics: Additional, fixed length data items (types and values).

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: Additional, non fixed length, data items (types and values).

interactionClass.name: ActionResponseR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an ActionResponseR interaction from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the federate has implemented the request.

interactionClass.name: Comment
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction used to insert messages and information into a log stream and closely matches the structures used by the Data interaction class. This information is usually unsolicited in nature. The information contained within the Interaction should be used for commenting purposes only.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: The set of data items (types and values) associated with the interaction.

interactionClass.name: CreateEntity
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that an application creates an entity. See DIS 4.5.5.4.1 and DIS 5.3.6 for details.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The FederateIdentifier field identifies the federate that is responsible for creating the entity (if possible). The complete parameter defines the entity ID of the new entity (see also note [18]).

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

interactionClass.name: CreateEntityR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that an application creates an entity, using a specified acknowledgement service. See DIS 4.5.11.3.1 and DIS 5.3.12.1 for details.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: Data
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge either a) a DataQuery interaction (in which case the Data interaction contains the results of the query) or b) a SetData interaction (in which case the Data interaction contains the data that the federate was able to set).

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific SetData or DataQuery interaction sent by the simulation manager.

parameter.name: FixedDatums
parameter.semantics: The set of data items (types and values), of fixed length, that the recipient can return for this interaction.

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: The set of data items (types and values), of variable length, that the recipient can return for this interaction.

interactionClass.name: DataR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge either a) a DataQueryR interaction (in which case the DataR interaction contains the results of the query) or b) a SetDataR interaction (in which case the DataR interaction contains the data that the federate was able to set).

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: DataQuery
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that a federate supply the current values of specified data.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: TimeInterval
parameter.semantics: The interval between regular updates of the requested data. If this field is zero then the recipient should only issue a single Data interaction in response to this interaction.

parameter.name: FixedDatumIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: The set of fixed length data items (types) that the recipient is requested to supply data for.

parameter.name: VariableDatumIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: The set of variable length data items (types) that the recipient is requested to supply data for.

interactionClass.name: DataQueryR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that a federate supply the current values of specified data. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: EventReport
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to allow a federate to alert a Simulation Manager federate that a particular event has occurred.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: EventType
parameter.semantics: The type of event being reported.

parameter.name: FixedDatums
parameter.semantics: The set of fixed size data items (types and values) associated with this event.

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: The set of variable size data items (types and values) associated with this event.

interactionClass.name: RemoveEntity
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that a specified entity be removed from the simulation.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

interactionClass.name: RemoveEntityR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that a specified entity be removed from the simulation.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: SetData
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that a federate sets the values of specified data to specified values.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: FixedDatums
parameter.semantics: The set of fixed length data items (types and values) that the recipient is requested to set.

parameter.name: VariableDatumSet
parameter.semantics: The set of variables length data items (types and values) that the recipient is requested to set.

interactionClass.name: SetDataR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that a federate sets the values of specified data to specified values. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: StartResume
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to either a) start simulating one or more entities or b) resume simulation of one or more entities after a pause.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RealWorldTime
parameter.semantics: The real world time (GMT) that the entity or entities should start/resume at.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: SimulationTime
parameter.semantics: The simulation time that the entity or entities should use when they start/resume.

interactionClass.name: StartResumeR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to either a) start simulating one or more entities or b) resume simulation of one or more entities after a pause. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: StopFreeze
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that one or more entities either a) freeze (pause) their simulation or b) stop their simulation.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: RealWorldTime
parameter.semantics: The real world time (GMT) that the entity or entities should stop/freeze at.

parameter.name: Reason
parameter.semantics: The reason for the stop or freeze.

parameter.name: ReflectValues
parameter.semantics: Whether the entity or entities being stopped/frozen should continue to reflect values when stopped/frozen.

parameter.name: RunInternalSimulationClock
parameter.semantics: Whether the entity or entities being stopped/frozen should continue to run their internal simulation clock when stopped/frozen.

parameter.name: UpdateAttributes
parameter.semantics: Whether the entity or entities being stopped/frozen should continue to update attributes when stopped/frozen.

interactionClass.name: StopFreezeR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that one or more entities either a) pause their simulation or b) stop their simulation. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: RecordR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a RecordQueryR or SetRecordR interaction from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the federate has implemented the request.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific RecordQueryR or SetRecordR interaction sent by the simulation manager.

parameter.name: EventType
parameter.semantics: The type of event that caused the RecordR interaction to be issued.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for the transaction

parameter.name: ResponseSerialNumber
parameter.semantics: Used to identify the serial number of the RecordR interaction when more than one interaction is used to report record values.

parameter.name: RecordSetData
parameter.semantics: The set of records containing the information requested

interactionClass.name: RecordQueryR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to allow a Simulation Manager federate to request data, in record format, from another federate.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: TimeInterval
parameter.semantics: The interval between regular updates of the requested data. If this field is zero then the recipient should only issue a single RecordR interaction in response to this interaction.

parameter.name: EventType
parameter.semantics: Specifies the type of event that the receiving entity or application should use to trigger the issue of a RecordR interaction in response to this query. If this is zero, then reporting shall be periodic based upon the value of the TimeInterval parameter.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for the transaction

parameter.name: RecordIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: Identifies the records for which information is requested

interactionClass.name: SetRecordR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to request that a federate sets the values of specified data to specified values (provided in record format).

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

parameter.name: RecordSetData
parameter.semantics: Specifies the information, in record format, to be set by the receiving entity.

interactionClass.name: TransferControl
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent to initiate the transfer of control of an entity.

parameter.name: OriginatingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application sending the interaction.

parameter.name: ReceivingEntity
parameter.semantics: The DIS entity ID of the entity or application which is the intended recipient(s) of the interaction.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

parameter.name: TransferType
parameter.semantics: The type of transfer to be performed.

parameter.name: TransferEntity
parameter.semantics: The ID of the object to be transferred.

parameter.name: RecordSetData
parameter.semantics: Specifies the information, in record format, to be set by the receiving entity.

interactionClass.name: AttributeChangeRequest
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to ask that a specified attribute be set to a specified value.

parameter.name: ObjectIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: The list of objects that are the intended recipients of this interaction.

parameter.name: AttributeValueSet
parameter.semantics: The set of attributes and their values, that the recipients are asked to update.

interactionClass.name: AttributeChangeRequestR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to ask that a specified attribute be set to a specified value. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: AttributeChangeResult
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an AttributeChangeRequest interaction from a Simulation Manager federate, and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the attribute was set to the specified value or not.

parameter.name: ObjectIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The ID of the object replying to the AttributeChangeRequest interaction.

parameter.name: AttributeChangeResult
parameter.semantics: Indicates ability to comply.

parameter.name: AttributeValueSet
parameter.semantics: The set of attributes and their values that the recipient has been able to update.

interactionClass.name: AttributeChangeResultR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an AttributeChangeRequest interaction from a Simulation Manager federate, and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the attribute was set to the specified value or not. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for this transaction

interactionClass.name: CreateObjectRequest
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to another federate requesting that it create an object instance of a particular type.

parameter.name: ObjectClass
parameter.semantics: The class of object to be created.

parameter.name: AttributeValueSet
parameter.semantics: The set of attributes, and associated values, to be used to initialize the object.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

interactionClass.name: CreateObjectRequestR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager federate to another federate requesting that it create an object instance of a particular type. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: CreateObjectResult
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a CreateObjectRequest from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the object creation was successful or not.

parameter.name: CreateObjectResult
parameter.semantics: Indicates ability to comply.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific CreateObject interaction sent by the simulation manager.

interactionClass.name: CreateObjectResultR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a CreateObjectRequest from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the object creation was successful or not. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

interactionClass.name: RemoveObjectRequest
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that one or more specified objects be removed from the simulation.

parameter.name: ObjectIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: The IDs of the objects to be removed.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: The Request ID is a monotonically increasing integer identifier inserted by the Simulation Manager into all Simulation management interactions. It is used as a unique identifier to identify the latest in a series of competing requests and identifying acknowledgements.

interactionClass.name: RemoveObjectRequestR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction, sent from a Simulation Manager to request that one or more specified objects be removed from the simulation.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for a transaction

interactionClass.name: RemoveObjectResult
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a RemoveObjectRequest interaction, and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the removal was successful or not.

parameter.name: RemoveObjectResult
parameter.semantics: Indicates ability to comply.

parameter.name: RequestIdentifier
parameter.semantics: This field matches this response with the specific RemoveObject interaction sent by the simulation manager.

interactionClass.name: RemoveObjectResultR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of a RemoveObjectRequestR interaction, and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the removal was successful or not.

interactionClass.name: ActionRequestToObject
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction sent from a Simulation Manager federate to one or more specific object instances to request that they perform a specified action.

parameter.name: ObjectIdentifiers
parameter.semantics: The list of objects that are the intended recipients of this interaction.

parameter.name: ActionRequestCode
parameter.semantics: The action that the recipient(s) are intended to perform.

interactionClass.name: ActionRequestToObjectR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction sent from a Simulation Manager federate to one or more specific object instances to request that they perform a specified action. The Simulation Manager federate specifies the acknowledgement protocol to be used.

parameter.name: AcknowledgementProtocol
parameter.semantics: The acknowledgement protocol to be used for this transaction

interactionClass.name: ActionResponseFromObject
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an ActionResponseToObject interaction from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the object has implemented the request.

parameter.name: ActionResult
parameter.semantics: The status of the request that the recipient has been asked to perform.

interactionClass.name: ActionResponseFromObjectR
interactionClass.semantics: A Simulation Management (SIMAN) interaction designed to acknowledge receipt of an ActionResponseToObjectR interaction from a Simulation Manager federate and to inform the Simulation Manager federate whether the object has implemented the request.

updateReflectTag.semantics: User-supplied tag provided with each update/reflect of object instance attribute values. Contains at least the DIS timestamp in the first 8 characters.

sendReceiveTag.semantics: User-supplied tag provided with each send/receive of an interaction. Contains at least the DIS timestamp in the first 8 characters.

simpleData.name: MMSIInteger32
simpleData.semantics: A 30-bit value. The MMSI number (Maritime Mobile Service Identity) is a unique nine-digit number for identifying an AIS station.

simpleData.name: UnitModelInteger8
simpleData.semantics: A 4-bit value. (Part B) Unit Model Code.

simpleData.name: SerialNumberInteger32
simpleData.semantics: A 2-bit value. (Part B) Serial Number.

simpleData.name: DesignatedAreaCodeInteger32
simpleData.semantics: A 10-bit value. Designated area code (DAC).

simpleData.name: FunctionIdInteger32
simpleData.semantics: A 6-bit value. Functional ID (FID).

simpleData.name: IMOInteger32
simpleData.semantics:
A 30-bit value. The International Maritime Organization (IMO) number is a unique identifier for vessels. See https://www.itu.int/en/ITU-R.
The IMO number is made of the three letters "IMO" followed by a seven-digit number. This number consists of a six-digit sequential unique number followed by a check digit. The integrity of an IMO number can be verified using its check digit. This is done by multiplying each of the first six digits by a factor of 2 to 7 corresponding to their position from right to left. The rightmost digit of this sum is the check digit. For example, for IMO 9074729: (97) + (06) + (75) + (44) + (73) + (22) = 139.
This attribute represents the 7 digits value of the IMO number. The value shall be zero for not available (default). The value shall also be zero for inland vessels.

simpleData.name: DegreesPerSecondFloat32
simpleData.semantics: The turn rate in decimal degrees per second, where: (a) zero value: not turning; (b) positive value: turning right; (c) negative value: turning left.

simpleData.name: DraughtMeterFloat32
simpleData.semantics: The vertical distance between the waterline and the bottom of the hull (keel) including the thickness of the hull; Draught determines the minimum depth of water a ship or boat can safely navigate.

simpleData.name: QuantityInt32

simpleData.name: DirectionDegreesFloat32

simpleData.name: LongitudeFloat64

simpleData.name: RichterScale
simpleData.semantics: Richter magnitude is measured in energy (ergs): M=log10 (A/A0), where A=amplitude on a seismograph, and A0=1/1,000 millimeters. Each increase of 1 in Richter magnitude represents a 31-fold increase in released energy.

simpleData.name: PrecipitationIntensityFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Light rain when the precipitation rate is < 2.5 mm (0.098 in) per hour. Moderate rain when the precipitation rate is between 2.5 mm (0.098 in) - 7.6 mm (0.30 in) or 10 mm (0.39 in) per hour. Heavy rain when the precipitation rate is > 7.6 mm (0.30 in) per hour, or between 10 mm (0.39 in) and 50 mm (2.0 in) per hour. Violent rain when the precipitation rate is > 50 mm (2.0 in) per hour.

arrayData.name: FederateName

arrayData.name: GeodeticPolygon
arrayData.semantics: A sequence of geodetic locations defines a geographical area bounded by a closed path where the first and last locations in the sequence are connected. Each point is a geodetic coordinate in WGS84 on the earth's surface, and each segment is a great circle between locations.

arrayData.name: UUID
arrayData.semantics:
RFC 4122, section 4.1.2 using 16 bytes. Also referred to as Variant 1 or RFC 4122/DCE 1.1 UUIDs.
For example, 00112233-4455-8877-6699-aabbccddeeff is encoded as the bytes 00 11 22 33 44 55 88 77 66 99 aa bb cc dd ee ff.

arrayData.name: SymbolIdentifier
arrayData.semantics: A symbol identifier is represented as a string. The identifier uses a URI notation (uri:xxxxxxxxxx) where the URI moniker specifies the symbology standard, e.g. app6a, app6b, app6c, 2525b, 2525c, 2525d. If not provided, the federation agreement defines the default symbol standard.

arrayData.name: RPRUserDefinedTag
arrayData.semantics:
The array shall be at least 8 bytes (octets) in size, which shall contain the time according to the DIS time stamp field format (IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.31) converted into hexadecimal American Standard Code for Information Interchange (ASCII) character representation (0-9 and A-F), with leading zeros included. The ordering of the characters shall be in accordance with section 5.1.1 of IEEE 1278.1-1995, that is most significant octet first, with the most significant bits first (i.e. the character for bits 4-7 precedes the character for bits 0-3). This encoding is equivalent to the result of the 'C'-statement "sprintf(UserTag, "%08X", DIStimestamp)," where 'DIStimestamp' is represented in native format.
More user-supplied information may be included, starting from the 9th character, as specified in the federation agreements.

A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that consists of a one-letter reliability rating and a one-number credibility rating. Max length 2 characters.
Reliability Ratings: A-completely reliable B-usually reliable C-fairly reliable D-not usually reliable E-unreliable F-reliability cannot be judged
Credibility Ratings: 1-confirmed by other sources 2-probably true 3-possibly true 4-doubtfully true 5-improbable 6-truth cannot be judged.

Credibility Ratings: 1-confirmed by other sources 2-probably true 3-possibly true 4-doubtfully true 5-improbable 6-truth cannot be judged.

Credibility Ratings: 1-confirmed by other sources 2-probably true 3-possibly true 4-doubtfully true 5-improbable 6-truth cannot be judged.

field.name: DisruptionEnabled
field.semantics: Disruption enabled or disabled. Default is True = Enabled.

fixedRecordData.name: LinkStatusStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Status of a physical network link.

field.name: TransmitterDevice
field.semantics: Reference to Transmitting network device.

field.name: ReceiverDevice
field.semantics: Reference to Receiving network device.

field.name: Latency
field.semantics: Delay in data delivery.

field.name: Bandwidth
field.semantics: Amount of data per time unit.

field.name: Reliability
field.semantics: Reliability of connection in terms of availability. 100% = always available and no connection loss.

field.name: IsBidirectional
field.semantics: True is link is bi-directional. By default this value should be set to false.

fixedRecordData.name: NetworkDeviceStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Describes the type and capability of a network device. Each device must have at least a transmitter (TX) or receiver (RX). Transceivers should define both.

field.name: NetworkDeviceId
field.semantics: Unique identifier for network device.

field.name: NetworkDeviceModel
field.semantics: Optional name of the model of network device (e.g. a radio model name). Max length 64 characters.

field.name: CommunicationNetworks
field.semantics: Reference to all communication networks this device is used for. In case of no network and the device is an intercepter, it will intercept all transmissions to all networks of the physical network.

field.name: PhysicalNetwork
field.semantics: Reference to physical network this device is connected to.

field.name: TX
field.semantics: Transmitter characteristics of the network device.

field.name: RX
field.semantics: Receiver characteristics of the network device.

field.name: IsRelay
field.semantics: True if this network device acts as a relay. By default this value should be set to true.

fixedRecordData.name: PhysicalGenericNetworkStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Characteristics of a generic physical network.

field.name: MaxHopCount
field.semantics: The maximum nuber of hops allowed in the physical network.

field.name: DefaultMaxLinkRange
field.semantics: The maximum distance between sending and receiving entities in a physical network link.

field.name: Latency
field.semantics: Delay in data delivery.

field.name: Bandwidth
field.semantics: Amount of data per time unit.

field.name: Reliability
field.semantics: Reliability of connection in terms of availability. 100% = always available and no connection loss.

fixedRecordData.name: RequestedConnection
fixedRecordData.semantics: Characterisation of a requested connection.

field.name: CommunicationNetwork
field.semantics: Reference to the communication network which the requested connection should belong to.

field.name: RequestedConnectionType
field.semantics: The type of connection requested.

field.name: ConnectionId
field.semantics: Requested Id for the connection. If no Id is requested the value of this field should be all zeros.

field.name: DestinationEntities
field.semantics: List of entities intended as destinations for this requested connection. Leave empty in case of broadcasting or multicasting. If multiple receivers are specified it is assumed that messages will be sent sequentially to all recipients. Leave empty in broadcast / multicast cases.

field.name: NetworkDevice
field.semantics: Reference to the Network Device for the requested connection. If no specific network device is requested the value of this field should be all zeros. Specifies which device of the Node should be used for the connection. The device must be bound to the communication network. If not set a suitable device is selected automaticly.

fixedRecordData.name: ConnectionReceiverStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Characteristics of a connection to a receiver.

field.name: ReceiverEntity
field.semantics: Reference to a simulated entity receiving data through the connection.

field.name: Latency
field.semantics: Latency in reaching the receiving entity.

field.name: Bandwidth
field.semantics: The bandwidth of the connection to the receiving entity,

field.name: Reliability
field.semantics: The reliability of the connection to the receiving entity.

field.name: HopCount
field.semantics: Number of hops required to reach the receiver. If set to 0 = not specified or calculated.

fixedRecordData.name: NetworkDeviceGenericTransmitterCharacteristicsStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Generic description of network device transmitter.

field.name: MaxLinkRange
field.semantics: Range limit for the link in meters. By default this value should be set to zero. If zero the max link range is based on the default value from the associated physical network.

fixedRecordData.name: IncomingConnectionStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Characteristics of a specific incoming connection.

field.name: CommunicationNetwork
field.semantics: Reference to the communication network associated with the incoming connection.

field.name: SendingEntity
field.semantics: Reference by UUID to the simulated entity at the sending end of the connection.

field.name: Latency
field.semantics: Delay in data delivery.

field.name: Bandwidth
field.semantics: Amount of data per time unit.

field.name: Reliability
field.semantics: Reliability of connection in terms of availability. 100% = always available and no connection loss.

field.name: HopCount
field.semantics: The number of hops in physical network required for sender entity to reach receiver entity.

field.name: SensorDamageState
field.semantics: The damage status of the sensor

field.name: SensorCoverage
field.semantics: The maximum range of the sensor

fixedRecordData.name: DetectedEquipment
fixedRecordData.semantics: Equipment at the spotted entity.

field.name: Type
field.semantics: Use entity types from Supply Types, Expendibles or Sensors/Emitters tables (SISO-REF-010-2010, 4.3), for aggregate entities, also use entity types from platform tables to describe the equipment type.

field.name: NumberOfEquipment
field.semantics: The number of the equipment.

fixedRecordData.name: TrackStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Descripton of the observed entity. The symbol contains information about the spotted entity's relation to the spotter and details about the type and echelon at the spotted entity.

field.name: Track
field.semantics: Unique identifier for a track. A new unique track id is generated if the sensor lose track of the entity.

field.name: Entity
field.semantics: The unique identifier for the detected entity (ground truth)

field.name: IdentificationLevel
field.semantics: Required. The identification level of the tracked entity.

field.name: Equipment
field.semantics:
Spotted equipment list, type and number.
Default value: Empty array.

field.name: Location
field.semantics: The location where the entity were spotted

field.name: Orientation
field.semantics: The orientation in Psi, Theta, Phi [radians]

field.name: Speed
field.semantics:
The speed of the entity (m/s).
Default value: 0 m/s

field.name: Activity
field.semantics: The current activity of the entity. (Fromm NETN-Base) Default value: Moving (213)

field.name: Symbol
field.semantics: Symbol identifier for the entity. The detailed level may vary and the publishing federate decides the level of details in the symbol description. E.g. Default Ground value: app6b:SUGP------***** Default Air value: app6b:SUAP------***** Default Sea Surface value: app6b:SUSP------***** Default Subsurface value: app6b:SUUP------*****

fixedRecordData.name: ObservedEquipment
fixedRecordData.semantics: Equipment at the observed entity.

field.name: Type
field.semantics: Use entity types from Supply Types, Expendibles or Sensors/Emitters tables (SISO-REF-010-2010, 4.3), for aggregate entities, also use entity types from platform tables to describe the equipment type.

field.name: NumberOfEquipment
field.semantics: The number of the equipment.

fixedRecordData.name: FollowEntityTaskStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task-specific data for FollowEntity

field.name: FollowedEntity
field.semantics: Reference to the entity to follow.

field.name: Behind
field.semantics: The distance in meters behind the entity to follow.

field.name: Right
field.semantics: The distance in meters to the right of the entity to follow.

field.name: Above
field.semantics: The distance in meters above the entity to follow.

field.name: Duration

fixedRecordData.name: TaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Fixed record to describe the definition of a task.

field.name: TaskId
field.semantics: Unique identifier for the task.

field.name: TaskedEntity
field.semantics: Reference to who is executing the task.

field.name: Tasker
field.semantics: Callsign of the commander of the task.

field.name: StartTime
field.semantics: Timestamp of when the task should start.

field.name: Annotation
field.semantics: A general text describing information about this task. The annotation may e.g. include the reason for the task and text describing names of referenced entities.

field.name: TaskMode
field.semantics: Determines the task mode.

field.name: Activity
field.semantics: Suggested activity for unit executing this task.

field.name: Status
field.semantics: Current status of this task.

field.name: TaskParameters
field.semantics: Task specific definition details.

field.name: MainTask
field.semantics: Unique identifier of the main task if this task is part of a complex task sequence. Equals TaskId if this task is the main task.

field.name: PreviousTask
field.semantics: Unique identifier of the previous task if this task is part of a complex task sequence. Null if this task is the first in the sequence.

field.name: NextTask
field.semantics: Unique identifier of the next task if this task is part of a complex task sequence. Null if this task is the last in the sequence.

fixedRecordData.name: TaskProgress
fixedRecordData.semantics: Fixed record to describe the progress of an executing task.

field.name: TaskId
field.semantics: Reference to the task this progress belongs to.

field.name: LastUpdated
field.semantics: When was this task last updated.

field.name: ExecutingFederateId
field.semantics: Reference to the federate that is executing this task.

field.name: ETC
field.semantics: Estimated time to completion.

field.name: ProgressData
field.semantics: Variant record with task specific progress data.

fixedRecordData.semantics: Task-specific data for MoveToLocation task.

field.name: Location
field.semantics: Location to move to.

field.name: Path
field.semantics: Path to use in order to move to Location.

field.name: MoveType
field.semantics: Indicates if roads have to be followed.

field.semantics: Initial speed of the entity.

fixedRecordData.name: PatrolTaskStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task-specific data for a Patrol task.

field.name: Path
field.semantics: Specifies the route to patrol.

field.name: PatrolType
field.semantics: Defined how the patrol should be executed. The full movement from start point, through the patrol route and back to the start point is called one cycle.

field.name: MoveType
field.semantics: Defines how the entity shall move during the patrol route.

field.name: Duration
field.semantics: The duration of the patrol task. The path will be patrolled minimum 1 time. When time has expired no patrol along the path will start.

field.name: IntervalTime
field.semantics: The time between the start of two patrol cycles, i.e. the time to complete a cycle and any waiting time before starting the next cycle.

fixedRecordData.name: DirectFireTaskStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task-specific data for direct fire.

field.name: Target

field.name: Heading

fixedRecordData.name: ArticulatedParameterStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics:
Structure to specify a movable or attached part of an entity. Based on the Articulation Parameter record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.5.
Note that usage of this datatype for the PhyscialEntity object class attribute ArticulatedParametersArray and MunitionDetonation interaction class parameter ArticulatedPartData shall be in accordance with IEEE 1278.1-1995 Annex A.

field.name: ArticulatedParameterChange
field.semantics: Indicator of a change to the part. This field shall be set to zero for each exercise and sequentially incremented by one for each change in articulation parameters. In the case where all possible values are exhausted, the numbers shall be reused beginning at zero.

field.name: PartAttachedTo
field.semantics: Identification of the articulated part to which this articulation parameter is attached. This field shall contain the value zero if the articulated part is attached directly to the entity.

field.name: ParameterValue
field.semantics: Details of the parameter: whether it is an articulated or an attached part, and its type and value.

fixedRecordData.name: ArticulatedPartsStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Structure to represent the state of a movable part of an entity.

field.name: Class
field.semantics: The type class uniquely identifies a particular articulated part on a given entity type. Guidance for uniquely assigning type classes to an entity's articulated parts is given in section 4.8 of the enumeration document (SISO-REF-010).

field.name: TypeMetric
field.semantics: The type metric uniquely identifies the transformation to be applied to the articulated part.

field.name: Value
field.semantics: Value of the transformation to be applied to the articulated part.

fixedRecordData.name: AttachedPartsStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Structure to represent removable parts that may be attached to an entity.

field.name: Station
field.semantics: Identification of the location (or station) to which the part is attached.

field.name: StoreType
field.semantics: The entity type of the attached part.

field.name: PaddingTo32

field.name: SampleRate

field.name: DataLength
field.semantics: The length of the signal data.

field.name: SampleCount
field.semantics: The number of samples in this transmission.

field.name: Data
field.semantics: The signal data.

fixedRecordData.name: BeamAntennaStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Specifies the direction, pattern, and polarization of radiation from a radio transmitter's antenna.

field.name: BeamOrientation
field.semantics: The rotation that transforms the reference coordinate system into the beam coordinate system.

field.name: BeamAzimuthBeamwidth
field.semantics: The full width of the beam to the -3 dB power density points in the x-y plane of the beam coordinate system.

field.name: BeamElevationBeamwidth
field.semantics: The full width of the beam to the -3 dB power density points in the x-z plane of the beam coordinate system.

field.name: ReferenceSystem
field.semantics: The reference coordinate system with respect to which beam direction is specified

field.name: Ez
field.semantics: The magnitude of the Z-component (in beam coordinates) of the Electrical field at some arbitrary single point in the mainbeam and in the far field of the antenna.

field.name: Ex
field.semantics: The magnitude of the X-component (in beam coordinates) of the Electrical field at some arbitrary single point in the mainbeam and in the far field of the antenna

field.name: BeamPhaseAngle
field.semantics: The phase angle between Ez and Ex in radians.

field.name: SegmentParameters

field.name: Padding
field.semantics: Padding to 64 bits

fixedRecordData.name: EntityIdentifierStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Unique, exercise-wide identification of the entity, or a symbolic group address referencing multiple entities or a simulation application. Based on the Entity Identifier record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.14.

field.name: FederateIdentifier
field.semantics: Simulation application (federate) identifier.

field.name: EntityNumber
field.semantics: Each entity in a given simulation application shall be given an entity identifier number unique to all other entities in that application. This identifier number is valid for the duration of the exercise; however, entity identifier numbers may be reused when all possible numbers have been exhausted. No entity shall have an entity identifier number of NO_ENTITY (0), ALL_ENTITIES (0xFFFF), or RQST_ASSIGN_ID (0xFFFE). The entity identifier number need not be registered or retained for future exercises. An entity identifier number equal to zero with valid site and application identification shall address a simulation application. An entity identifier number equal to ALL_ENTITIES shall mean all entities within the specified site and application. An entity identifier number equal to RQST_ASSIGN_ID allows the receiver of the CreateEntity interaction to define the entity identifier number of the new entity. The new entity will specify its entity identifier number in the Acknowledge interaction.

fixedRecordData.name: EntityTypeStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Type of entity. Based on the Entity Type record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.16.

field.name: EntityKind

field.name: Extra

field.name: Subcategory

field.name: Specific
field.semantics: Identifies specific information about an environmental entity based on the Subcategory field

field.name: Extra
field.semantics: Specifies extra information required to describe a particular environmental entity

fixedRecordData.name: EventIdentifierStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Identification of an event. Based on the Event Identifier record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.18.

field.name: EventCount
field.semantics: The event number. Uniquely assigned by the simulation application (federate) that initiates the sequence of events. It shall be set to one for each exercise and incremented by one for each event. In the case where all possible values are exhausted, the numbers may be reused beginning again at one.

field.name: IssuingObjectIdentifier
field.semantics: Identification of the object issuing the event.

fixedRecordData.name: ExhaustSmokeStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Record specifying the characteristics of a linear object smoke segment

field.name: SegmentParameters
field.semantics: Specifies the linear object smoke segment characteristics

field.name: PercentOpacity
field.semantics: Specifies the opacity of the linear object smoke segment

field.name: Attached
field.semantics: Specifies whether the linear object smoke segment is attached to the vehicle

field.name: ChemicalContent
field.semantics: Specifies the chemical content of the linear object smoke segment

fixedRecordData.name: FederateIdentifierStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Unique identification of the simulation application (federate) in an exercise, or a symbolic group address referencing multiple simulation applications. Based on the Simulation Address record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.14.1.

field.name: SiteID
field.semantics: Each site shall be assigned a unique site identification. No individual site shall be assigned an identification number containing NO_SITE (0) or ALL_SITES (0xFFFF). An identification number equal to ALL_SITES (0xFFFF) shall mean all sites; this may be used to initialize or start all sites. The mechanism by which Site Identification numbers are assigned is part of federation agreements.

field.name: ApplicationID
field.semantics: Each simulation application (federate) at a site shall be assigned an identification number unique within that site. No simulation application shall be assigned an identification number containing NO_APPLIC (0) or ALL_APPLIC (0xFFFF). An application identification number equal to ALL_APPLIC (0xFFFF) shall mean all applications; this may be used to start all applications within a site. One or more simulation applications may reside in a single host computer. The mechanism by which application identification numbers are assigned is part of federation agreements.

fixedRecordData.name: FixedDatumStruct

field.name: FixedDatumIdentifier
field.semantics: The identifier for this fixed datum.

field.name: FixedDatumValue
field.semantics: The value for this fixed datum.

fixedRecordData.name: FundamentalParameterDataStruct

field.name: ERP
field.semantics: The average peak radiated power of the emission.

field.name: Frequency
field.semantics: The center frequency of the emission.

field.name: PgRF
field.semantics: When applied to originators, this field shall specify the number of interrogations per second emitted. This field shall be set to zero when applied to a responder (i.e. transponder) systems.

field.name: PulseWidth
field.semantics: The duration of the fundamental pulse of which the interrogation or reply is composed.

field.name: BurstLength
field.semantics: The number of emissions generated in a single burst. This field shall contain zero for continuously emitting systems and shall contain the value 1 for responders.

field.name: ApplicableModes
field.semantics: Specifies the modes to which the fundamental parameter data applies.

field.name: Padding
field.semantics: Padding to 32 bits

field.name: InitialValue
field.semantics: Specifies the coordinate of the origin (or initial value) for the Xi axis

field.name: FinalValue

field.semantics: Specifies the integer valued interleaf factor along a domain (grid) Xi axis ; a value of one shall indicate no sub-sampling (interleaving), while integer values greater than one shall indicate the sampling frequency along an axis

field.name: InitialIndex

field.semantics: Specifies the coordinate values for the Ni grid locations along the irregular (variable spacing) Xi axis

field.name: PaddingTo64
field.semantics: Brings the record length to a 64-bit boundary

fixedRecordData.name: LinearSegmentStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Specifies linear object segment characteristics.

field.name: SegmentNumber
field.semantics: Identifies the individual segment.

field.name: PercentComplete
field.semantics: Specifies the percent completion of the segment.

field.name: Location
field.semantics: Specifies the location of the segment.

field.name: Orientation
field.semantics: Specifies the orientation of the segment.

field.name: Length
field.semantics: Specifies the length of the segment, in meters, extending in the positive X direction.

field.name: Width
field.semantics: Specifies the total width of the segment, in meters; one-half of the width shall extend in the positive Y direction, and one-half of the width shall extend in the negative Y direction.

field.name: Height
field.semantics: Specifies the height of the segment, in meters, above ground.

field.name: Depth
field.semantics: Specifies the depth of the segment, in meters, below ground level.

field.name: DamagedState
field.semantics: Specifies the damaged appearance of the segment.

field.name: Deactivated
field.semantics: Specifies whether or not the segment has been deactivated (it has ceased to exist in the synthetic environment).

field.name: Flaming
field.semantics: Specifies whether or not the segment is aflame.

field.name: ObjectPreDistributed
field.semantics: Specifies whether or not the segment was created before the start of the exercise.

field.name: Smoking
field.semantics: Specifies whether or not the segment is smoking (creating a smoke plume).

fixedRecordData.name: ShaftDataStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Rotation state of a ship's propulsion shaft

field.name: CurrentShaftRate
field.semantics: The current shaft speed. A positive shaft speed indicates that the shaft is rotating in a clockwise direction (when viewed from the stern to bow), and a negative shaft speed indicates an anti-clockwise direction.

field.name: OrderedShaftRate
field.semantics: The ordered shaft speed. If the ordered shaft speed is different from the current shaft speed then the shaft will accelerate or decelerate at the shaft rate of change. A positive shaft speed indicates that the shaft is rotating in a clockwise direction (when viewed from the stern to bow), and a negative shaft speed indicates an anti-clockwise direction.

field.name: ShaftRateOfChange
field.semantics: The absolute value of the shaft's rotational acceleration. The shaft will change its rotational speed at this rate if the current shaft speed differs from the ordered shaft rate.

fixedRecordData.name: SilentAggregateStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: These fields contain information about subaggregates not registered in the federation.

field.name: AggregateType
field.semantics: This field shall specify the aggregates common to this system list.

field.name: NumberOfAggregatesOfThisType
field.semantics: This field shall specify the number of aggregates that have the type specified in AggregateType field.

fixedRecordData.name: SilentEntityStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: These fields contain information about entities not registered in the federation.

field.name: NumberOfEntitiesOfThisType
field.semantics: This field shall specify the number of entities that have the type specified in the field EntityType.

field.name: NumberOfAppearanceRecords
field.semantics: This field shall specify the number of Entity Appearance records that follow. This number shall be between zero and the number of entities of this type. Simulation applications representing the aggregate that do not model entity appearances shall set this field to zero. Simulation applications representing the aggregate that model entity appearances shall set this field to the number of entity appearances that deviate from the default appearance. Other simulations can safely assume that any entity appearances not specified are default appearances.

field.name: EntityType
field.semantics: This field shall specify the entity types common to the entities in this system list.

field.name: EntityAppearance
field.semantics: This field shall specify the entity appearances of entities in the aggregate that deviate from the default. The length of the array is defined in the NumberOfAppearanceRecords field.

field.name: FHNetID
field.semantics: Frequency hopping network identifier.

field.name: HopSetID
field.semantics: Identification for the set of frequencies used when creating a hopping pattern.

field.name: LockoutSetID
field.semantics: Identification for the set of frequencies that are excluded from the hopping pattern.

field.name: TransmissionSecurityKey
field.semantics: Identifies the transmission security key that is used when generating the hopping pattern.

field.name: FHSynchronizationTimeOffset
field.semantics: The offset to exercise time in seconds for the clock in the radio.

field.name: Orientation
field.semantics: The angles of rotation around the coordinate axes between the object's attitude and the reference coordinate system axes (calculated as the Tait-Bryan Euler angles specifying the successive rotations needed to transform from the world coordinate system to the entity coordinate system).

field.name: VelocityVector
field.semantics: The rate at which an object's position is changing over time.

fixedRecordData.semantics: Specifies the direction and radiation pattern from a radio transmitter's antenna.
